headline: Billionaires Lose Combined $208 Billion in One Day From Trump Tariffs
summary: (Bloomberg) -- The world’s 500 richest people saw their combined wealth plunge by $208 billion Thursday as broad tariffs announced by President Donald Trump sent global markets into a tailspin. headline: Stocks Plummet as World Leaders Respond to Trump Tariff Blitz
summary: U.S. stock indexes saw their biggest drop in value since March 2020, one day after President Trump announced a 10% across-the-board tariff for all foreign imports, and higher rates for other countries.

headline: Amazon and Meta Share in China’s Tariff Pain - Heard on the Street
summary: Chinese e-commerce merchants are going to have a much harder time selling their products in the U.S. - at least at cut-rate prices.  Among megacap tech stocks, Amazon and Meta were the hardest hit in Thursday’s tariff-sparked selloff, save for Apple.  The two stocks closed down 9% on Thursday, with Meta losing twice as much on a percent basis as Google-parent Alphabet, which is its largest rival in online advertising.

The two stocks closed down 9% on Thursday, with Meta losing twice as much on a percent basis as Google-parent Alphabet, which is its largest rival in online advertising.

headline: Trump's "Reciprocal Tariffs": Why Major AI Stocks Apple, Meta, and Alphabet (Google) Are Feeling the Heat Today
summary: The whole U.S. stock market is feeling the pain from the sweeping new tariffs that President Trump announced Wednesday after the market closed.  As of 1:10 p.m. ET Thursday, the blue chip Dow Jones Industrial Average had fallen by over 1,300 points (3.1%), the broad market S&P 500 was off by 3.9%, and the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite was down by 4.9%.  At that time, shares of Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) traded more than 8% lower, Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META) was down more than 6%, and shares of Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOGL) were off by more than 3%.

raw.headline: Trump's "Reciprocal Tariffs": Why Major AI Stocks Apple, Meta, and Alphabet (Google) Are Feeling the Heat Today

headline: Meta’s Ad Business Relies a Lot on China. Tariffs Could Hurt It, Warns Analyst.
summary: Meta Platforms is likely to get hit by tariffs in a somewhat roundabout way.  Brands may pull back on marketing spending, as selling products to the U.S. stands to become more expensive, according to advertising analyst Brian Wieser.  Wieser estimates roughly $10 billion of Meta’s revenue for ads shown in the U.S. originates from advertisers located outside the country–mainly from China.

headline: Meta Platforms (NasdaqGS:META) Partners With UFC For Enhanced Fan Engagement Following US$4% Share Dip
summary: Recently, Meta Platforms (NasdaqGS:META) entered a significant multiyear partnership with UFC to enhance fan engagement, potentially strengthening the brand's position in fan technology. Despite this development, Meta's shares declined by 3% over the last quarter. This decline coincides with broader market reactions to new tariffs announced by President Trump, which affected tech stocks across the board, including a notable 7% drop in Meta on the day of the announcement. headline: 2 Growth Stocks Down 22% to 53% to Buy in 2025
summary: The recent market correction is raising anxiety for some investors, but the stock market historically rises for longer stretches than it falls.  Shares of Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META) delivered excellent returns over the last 10 years, rising more than 585%.  The company fueled those returns with annualized revenue growth of 29%, and it's still growing at high rates that could support more market-beating gains in the coming years.
